item.title: Danielle add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Speak softly and carry a big stick; you will go far." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Only the Dead stay seventeen forever." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "Life is made of fear. Some people eat fear soup three times a day. Some people eat fear soup all the meals there are. I eat it sometimes. When they bring me fear soup to eat, I try not to eat it, I try to send it back. But sometimes I'm too afraid to and have to eat it anyway." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Alice Sebold
item.description: "You save yourself or you remain unsaved." -- Alice Sebold

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Alice Sebold
item.description: "Murderers are not monsters, they're men. And that's the most frightening thing about them." -- Alice Sebold

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Danielle add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Do I dare Disturb the universe? In a minute there is time For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Danielle add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Danielle add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "For I have known them all already, known them allâ€” Have known the evenings, mornings, afternoons, I have measured out my life with coffee spoons." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Danielle add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Nobody owns life, but anyone who can pick up a frying pan owns death." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Danielle add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Danielle add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Draw a crazy picture, Write a nutty poem, Sing a mumble-gumble song, Whistle through your comb. Do a loony-goony dance 'Cross the kitchen floor, Put something silly in the world That ain't been there before." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Patrick Hamilton
item.description: "Too much thought is bad for the soul, for art, and for crime. It is also a sign of middle age." -- Patrick Hamilton

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Wally Lamb
Danielle add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I hate feelings. Why does sobriety have to come with feelings?" -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Michael Ventura
item.description: "Be careful how you choose your enemy, for you will come to resemble him. The moment you adapt your enemy's methods your enemy has won. The rest is suffering and historical opera. " -- Michael Ventura

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Jay McInerney
item.description: "The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families." -- Jay McInerney

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Sheng Wang
item.description: "Why do people say "grow some balls"? Balls are weak and sensitive. If you wanna be tough, grow a vagina. Those things can take a pounding." -- Sheng Wang
